content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feed xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <title>Edinburgh College of Art</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/240" rel="alternate"/> <subtitle/> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/240</id> <updated>2015-03-19T02:03:14Z</updated> <dc:date>2015-03-19T02:03:14Z</dc:date> <entry> <title>Four cover designs for the EAR 33rd Edition 2013</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/677" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/677</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:34Z</updated> <published>2014-12-11T10:49:55Z</published> <summary type="text">Four cover designs for the EAR 33rd Edition 2013 Cover design tests for the 33rd Edition of the Edinburgh Architecture Research journal. The 2013 publication EAR Vol. 33 focused on the theme: Methodologies for Sustainable Projects. The images used for the four cover designs aimed to address the theme through the projection of light or images onto paper, wool, skin and canvas. The four covers were submitted for competition. The cover 'Jungenfeld_EAR33_CoverDesign_2.jpg' was selected for publication. </summary> <dc:date>2014-12-11T10:49:55Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>LLEAPP 2013 final performance recording</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/672" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/672</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:34Z</updated> <published>2014-11-19T13:09:00Z</published> <summary type="text">LLEAPP 2013 final performance recording This is a live recording of the final performance of the LLEAPP 2013 workshop on 18th April 2013 at Inspace, Edinburgh. Performers were: Lauren Hayes, Frauke Aulbert, Rob Canning, Owen Green, Marinos Koutsomichalis, Adam Linson, Emma Lloyd, Christos Michalakos, Amit Patel, Jules Rawlinson, Radek Rudnicki, Bill Vine, Sean Williams. Musical Director was Jan Hendrickse. Performers were located throughout the space, and audio was recorded in 4 channels, mixed down to a stereo version. </summary> <dc:date>2014-11-19T13:09:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>LLEAPP 2013 performance video 16</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/670" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/670</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:33Z</updated> <published>2014-11-18T17:59:58Z</published> <summary type="text">LLEAPP 2013 performance video 16 This is a video recording from the performance at the end of LLEAPP 2013 workshop held from 16-19 April 2013 at the University of Edinburgh. The data set also includes a number of live performances of the work given by Peter Furniss in 2014. The recordings are not polished final mixes but documentary examples of work in progress. </summary> <dc:date>2014-11-10T16:25:50Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>LLEAPP 2009 score Group 2</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/630" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/630</id> <updated>2015-03-03T13:32:03Z</updated> <published>2014-09-24T09:35:16Z</published> <summary type="text">LLEAPP 2009 score Group 2 Scanned image of the performance score from the LLEAPP 2009 group 2: Owen Green, Jules Rawlinson, Jamie Thompson. This score relates to the performance appearing in the video: LLEAPP 2009 performance video 2 (http://dx.doi.org/10.7488/ds/73) in the LLEAPP 2009 collection. </summary> <dc:date>2014-09-24T09:35:16Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>LLEAPP 2009 performance video 4</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/629" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/629</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:34Z</updated> <published>2014-09-24T09:27:49Z</published> <summary type="text">LLEAPP 2009 performance video 4 This is a video recording of the performance at the end of LLEAPP 2009 in the Bongo Club, Edinburgh by the fourth of four groups: Miguel Ortiz, Nick Williams, Sean Williams. </summary> <dc:date>2014-09-24T09:27:49Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>LLEAPP 2009 performance video 3</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/628" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/628</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:34Z</updated> <published>2014-09-24T09:25:11Z</published> <summary type="text">LLEAPP 2009 performance video 3 This is a video recording of the performance at the end of LLEAPP 2009 in the Bongo Club, Edinburgh by the third of four groups: Jason Dixon, Lauren Hayes, Paul Keene, Justin Yang. </summary> <dc:date>2014-09-24T09:25:11Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>LLEAPP 2009 performance video 2</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/627" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/627</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:34Z</updated> <published>2014-09-24T09:22:39Z</published> <summary type="text">LLEAPP 2009 performance video 2 This is a video recording of the performance at the end of LLEAPP 2009 in the Bongo Club, Edinburgh by the second of four groups: Owen Green, Jamie Thompson, Jules Rawlinson. Performance score for this video available: LLEAPP 2009 score Group 2 (http://dx.doi.org/10.7488/ds/87). </summary> <dc:date>2014-09-24T09:22:39Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>LLEAPP 2009 performance video 1</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/626" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/626</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:34Z</updated> <published>2014-09-24T09:19:47Z</published> <summary type="text">LLEAPP 2009 performance video 1 This is a video recording of the performance at the end of LLEAPP 2009 in the Bongo Club, Edinburgh by the first of four groups: Cavan Fyans, Dave Murray-Rust, Adam Parkinson, Shiori Usui. </summary> <dc:date>2014-09-24T09:19:47Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Viewing practices in relation to contemporary television serial end credit sequences</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10283/625" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10283/625</id> <updated>2015-02-23T10:53:34Z</updated> <published>2014-09-16T15:53:04Z</published> <summary type="text">Viewing practices in relation to contemporary television serial end credit sequences Four focus groups were held in the UK (Leeds and Edinburgh) in February 2012 to explore television viewing practices in relation to the main title and end credit sequences of contemporary drama serials. Two audiovisual stimuli were used: an extended main title sequence, and the final lines of dialogue in an episode followed by the end credit sequence. This report summarises the findings in relation to end credit sequences. It is presented here as a supplement to the article "The End is Nigh: Music Postfaces and End Credit Sequences in Contemporary Television Serials", forthcoming (2014) in the journal Music, Sound and the Moving Image. </summary> <dc:date>2014-09-16T15:53:04Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
